dialogues.text: When I was a child I used to hear my guardian angel. She sang to me 'till I was six years old. That's when I stopped listening. But I remember the voice. A few years ago I looked at myself and saw nothing but a nun who was certain of nothing. Not even of Heaven. Not even of God. And then one evening I saw Agnes standing by her window, singing. And all my doubts about myself and God were gone, in that one moment. I recognized the voice. Please don't take it away from me again Doctor Livingston. Those years after six were very bleak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister died in a convent. And it's her voice I hear. (a long pause) Does my smoking bother you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it reminds me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like one? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha hands her a cigarette and lights it for her. Mothe Miriam coughs a lot. Martha pats her on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out of prac... (cough) ... practice. (cough)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you suppose the saints would have smoked if tobacco had been popular back then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undoubtedly. Not the ascetics of course but, well Saint Thomas More...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Long, thin and filtered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saint Ignatius would smoke cigars and stub them out on the soles of his bare feet. (they roar with laughter) And of course (distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand rolled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Christ would partake socially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saint Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pipe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Magdelen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you've come a long way baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Saint John would chew tobacco. More laughter, then the moment because more serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you suppose today's saints are smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no saints today. Good people yes, but extraordinarily good people... those I'm afraid we are sorely lacking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they ever existed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to become one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Become?     One is born a saint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can try, can't you, to be good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but goodness has very little to do with it. Not all the saints were good, in fact some of them were a little crazy. But... they were still attached to God. Agnes has that birth. (she stands) No more... we're born, we live, we die. No room for miracles. (Martha gets up too) Oh my dear, how I miss the miracles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start walking back to the convent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think Agnes is still attached to God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to her singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause) I'd like to begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begin what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hypnotism. Do you still disapprove?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it stop you if I did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I be present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's begin.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The room is painted white and completely empty with a ste sloping    ceiling. Agnes is sitting on a chair with her already under   hypnosis. Martha and Mother Miriam are fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're listening to a chorus of angels. The music surrounds you like a... warm and, comfortable pool of water. And while you're sleeping, you're going to be able to recall, all the things that we want you to remember. And when I count to three and clap my hands, you'll no longer be hypnotised. Can you hear me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Livingston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why am I here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Would you like to tell me why you're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of trouble? (no answer) What kind of trouble Agnes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha starts to walk around behind Agnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of telling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's easy. It's just a breath with sound. Say it. What kind of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause) I had a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Martha and Mother Miriam react with some degree of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you have a baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It came out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know what was going to come

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Did you want it to come out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Because I was afraid.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Why were you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Because I wasn't worthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be a mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: May I open my eyes now?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: No not yet Agnes, very soon but not yet. How did the baby get into you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It grew.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: What made it grow? Do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Would you like to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Did anyone else know about the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will she be angry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made me promise not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?     Who made you promise? (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's    alright Agnes. It's alright. (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's    go to your room. It's the night about    six weeks ago when you were very    sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh don't be, I'm here. It's alright. I want you to tell me what you did before you went to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm hmm. What did you have for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish... (distastefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... brussel sprouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like brussel sprouts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate them. Martha and Mother Miriam can't help smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went to chapel for vespers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left early because I wasn't feeling very well. Suddenly Agnes leaps up from her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's following me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Marguerite I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it Sister Marguerite who knew about the baby? (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright Agnes, I want you to see your room as you saw it on that night. MARTHA (Cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your eyes. (she opens them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crucifix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above the bed? Any... anything else? What do you you see, something different? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wastepaper basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who put it there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think it's there for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me to get sick in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel as if I've eaten glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to throw up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she falls to her knees, retching horribly. AGNES (Cont.) I can't... glass... one of the sisters has fed me glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know which one (distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of me. Oh... God! My God... (assumes the birth position and looks between her legs) Water... it's all water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why isn't anyone coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to wipe up the water) They can't hear me that's why. (in terrible pain) Oh God... I don't wanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Martha) Stop her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Agnes tries to crawl away as though terrified of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Please get away from me...

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Go away, I don't want you here.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Is someone in the room with you?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: No... don't hit me please...

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Stop this, she'll hurt herself (stepping forward) I'm not going to allow this.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: (hauling her away) NO... no... I said leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: (still screaming) You're trying to take my baby... trying to take my baby... no... (then quietly) It wasn't my fault Mommy... it was a mistake Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Alright Agnes... it's alright. One, two three... (claps her hands; Agnes comes to) It's alright... it's me, Doctor Livingston, it's alright, alright. Thankyou Agnes, thankyou. How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Frightened.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Do you remember what just happened?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: (a long pause) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: That's good. Do you feel well enough to stand?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha helps her to her feet. Agnes clings to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go. It's alright, it's alright, it's all over. It's alright Agnes, that's right, that's right.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Martha approaches the building and enters it.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The camera tracks through shelves of ancient records and maps. Ah excuse me. Hallo. I'm looking for some ah... ground plans for the ah... Saint Marie Madeleine Convent in (distorted). (answers in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha and a middle aged official come into view. He stops at a long set of        drawers and starts looking throug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (replies in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... very interesting I guess... (he pulls out a folder of plans) Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets the folder down on a table and starts going throu it. They both look at the plans. Ah viola! This has everything. Even the secret entrance. They all had that. Usually to get from building to building in the snow... (he indicates on the plan) ... like that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmurs) That's how he got in... or she got out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh excuse me, what did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. May I take some notes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, (distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha starts drawing a rough plan.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The crypt is deserted but candles are burning in front of statue of Saint Michael. Martha walks over to it,lights a goes behind it and finds a stairway there leading underground. She goes down into...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Martha walks through the dimly lit passage. She stops for moment to look at a cross carved on the stone floor, then continues. Fin she reaches more steps and goes up into the...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Martha emerges through a trapdoor in to the barn which is full of doves. It    begins to make sense for her.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Various closeups of famous statues. A bell is tolling. Tw nuns come out of a building, down streets, across the road as though traff did not exist and into another building.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The nuns are Sister Anne and Mother Miriam. In the lift a

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE GIRL
dialogues.text: checks her lipstick in the reflective metal walls. The li stops and the Sisters get off.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: They walk down the modern carpeted corridor into...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Mother Miriam addresses the secretary, HELEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the Doctor in her office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, who shall I say is calling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly) General MacArthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads onto Martha's office. Helen jumps up after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute please, you can't go in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Miriam pushes the door open to reveal Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing) It's... it's alright Helen, just close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Miriam walks in and throws some papers down onto Martha's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just met with the bishop. We're taking you off the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up the papers) You're what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we want to hire a psychiatrist for Agnes. we'll find our own, thank you. (starts to leave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One that will ask the questions you want asked.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: (halting) One that will approach this matter with some objectivity and respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the Church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Agnes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: You think she's a saint?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: She's been touched by God, yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: How? How? She hallucinates, stops eating and bleeds spontaneously. Is that supposed to convince me she shouldn't be touched. Give me a miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Why must he be anybody?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: (laughs and sits down) My God, you're as crazy as...

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Stop laughing, I don't say it's the truth, I'm saying...

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: How (distorted) ?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Well give me a reasonable explanation

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: A miracle is an event without an explanation. If she's capable of putting a hole in her hand without benefit of a nail, why couldn't she split a cell in her womb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: There as no man in the convent on that night and no way for any man to get in or out.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: You're saying God did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's as much as saying Father Martineau did it. I'm saying God permitted it.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: But how did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: You'll never find the answer for everything God did.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't believe in miracles today Mother?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: But I want the opportunity to believe. I want the choice to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what    you are choosing to believe is a lie    because you won't face the fact that she    was raped... or seduced... or that    she did the seducing.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: She is an innocent.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: But she is not an enigma Mother. Everything that Agnes has done is explainable from modern psychiatry. One, two, three, right down the line.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: That's what you believe she is?     The sum of her psychological parts?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: That's what I have to believe...

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Then why are you so obsessed with her? You're losing sleep over her? (Martha gets up disturbed) You're thinking about her all the time. You're bent on saving her. Why? Martha has no answer. MOTHER MIRIAM (Cont.) (calmer) I'm not accusing. I'm recognizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a tunnel out of the crypt into the barn. Did you know about that? There's an answer Mother. That's how she got out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy. How could she find out about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody told her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? That tun... that tunnel hasn't been used in fifty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, would you stop lying Mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's murder we're talking about. Aren't you concerned about what she told us about the other person in her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm concerned about her health.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that person Mother?    Was it you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you believe this is murder, it is the Crown attorney you have to talk to, not me. And definitely not Agnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes out and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: After a couple of establishing shots of the convent, the are shown ice   skating on the frozen pond. They are quit uninhibited, like little children. Their singing (off) from the chapel continues u the end of scene 78.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Sister Genevieve, the other novice is being consecrated. approaches the altar all dressed in white, carrying a sin and kneels down.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Martha and Justice Leveau come up the steps and into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I want is one more week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? (continues in French, You've done nothing to show any progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's because I'm getting to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting to all of us Martha, let's face it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a decision by next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone on long enough. You're out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Joe... Joe she didn't kill the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (halting) You have proof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking on) No, no, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get you new evidence next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow... tomorrow, I'll get it by tomorrow. I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the door of Leveau's office. He thinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, demain (?)

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The scene consists of a number of shots dissolving into o another. Sister Genevieve lying face down in front of the Genevieve praying on her   knees, her family (4) watching behind the grilled gate. Genevieve's hair being cut, her joy at the habit being fitted to her, running out to join her family, a jolly old singalong on the piano, this time the nuns singing along from    behind the gate.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Martha drives up in her car and walks across the now snow covered grounds to    the convent.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Mother Miriam is working away at her desk when a nun interrupts. Singing   from the party can faintly be heard Excuse me Mother, Doctor Livingston is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Miriam nods tiredly and goes to meet Martha at he door. Martha hands    her a court order. Mother Miriam reads it and hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is permission to take her apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't she had enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a few more questions to ask her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, but you're determined. They move back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knew she was pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you insist upon pressing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it because she's a nun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know she was pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't send her to a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't guess until it was too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?     An abortion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't be ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... too late to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scandal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went to the room to help with the birth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't want any help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted that child out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hid the wastepaper basket in her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't hide it. I put it there for the blood and the dirty sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tied the cord around its neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted her to have it when no-one else was around, they would have taken the baby to a hospital and left it with them, but it was such a difficult birth, there was so much blood and I panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before or after you killed the child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left it with her and I went for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt that's what she'd say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she's a liar.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: It is the same as before, except that this time Martha an Mother Miriam are      standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to remember if you can a night last January. The night Sister Paul died. Do you remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a flash cut to Sister Paul being annointed. Agne stirs slightly. MARTHA (Cont.) What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another flash cut, this time of Sister Paul sayi that mysterious word that we could not previously underst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a third flash cut of the shrine of Saint Michael the crypt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The statue. She had shown it to me the day before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the passage to the barn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I could go to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did she know about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd seen him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the belltower the day she before she died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she sent you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: In flashback:    Agnes is walking alone through the tunne carrying an oil lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes keeps walking and finally goes up the steps into...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Still in flashback, Agnes emerges into the barn. The dove flap about as Agnes    moves nervously through the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Back to the present:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you frightened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: In flashback: the doves continue to make flapping and bumping sounds as they fly around the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallo...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: In the present:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... where are you?

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: In flashback:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she seems to be talking to someone although we can s nothing except the doves. AGNES (Cont.) I... I'm afraid... yes, yes I do... why me?... wait, I want to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: In the present:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halos...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: In flashback: Agnes is still in the barn but now she is lying on her back. Still all we can see are doves flashing in the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... dividing and dividing feathers and starts, falling, falling into the iris of God's eye. Oh... oh!... it's... it's so lovely... it's so... blue... yellow... blood wings, brown, blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she lifts up her hands.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: In the present: as she lifts up her hands, Agnes is horrified to see two holes in her palms weeping blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His blood... my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha and Mother Miriam are equally shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Agnes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes runs terrified over to the walls blood pouring over white habit.    Mother Miriam rushes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bleeding... I'm bleeding... my God it won't stop, I can't get it to stop. (to Mother Miriam) Let go of me, I wish you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to hold her) Agnes... Agnes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes breaks free and runs over to another wall smearing too with blood.     Martha follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes it had nothing to do with the hand of God. He did a terrible thing to you, do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He    frightened you and he hurt you. It's not    your fault. It's his fault. Tell us who    he is so we can find him. Stop him    from doing this to other women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not your fault...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes who did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do. Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate him for what he did to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what he made me go through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes, who did this to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes flings her arms back against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God!  It was God. (sinks to her knees) And now I'll burn in hell because I hate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes you won't burn in hell. It's alright to hate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes, what happened to the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) She can't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was alive wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Oh, don't do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow this declaration seems to calm them down somewhat Mother Miriam   is looking utterly resigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Miriam was with you wasn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She took the baby in her arms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw it all didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then... what did she do? (no answer) Agnes what did she do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She... left me alone with that little thing, and I looked at it, and I thought this is a mistake. But it's my mistake, not Mommy's. God's mistake. AGNES (cont.) I thought I... I can save her. (she raises her hands) I can give her back to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put her to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H... how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tied the cord around her neck... wrapped her in the bloody sheets... and stuffed her in the trash can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Miriam gives a shuddering sigh, makes the sign of cross and prays. Martha claps her hands lightly together once.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: A shaft of sunlight shines through the winter clouds onto city. Angle on the courthouse.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: All the main characters are present: Eve, Lyon, Martha, Agnes, Sister   Marguerite and Mother Miriam. Justice Leveau is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In view of the situation as it now stands, and the testimony given here this morning, it seems quite clear that the defendant was in no manner responsible for her actions. It is therefore the judgement of this court that she be returned to the convent of Marie Madeleine where she will be cared for under proper medical supervision by a visiting physician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Martha and Mother Miriam show relief at this. Justic Leveau continues to sum up in French when suddenly Agnes stands up. (surprised) Oui. Do you have something to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long pause) I stood in the window of my room every night for a week. And one night I heard the most beautiful voice imaginable. And when I looked I saw the moon shining down on him. For six nights he sang to me, songs I'd never heard. And on the seventh night he opened his wings and lay on top of me. All the while he sang - (sings) Charlie Sweet... Charlie Sweet... Charlie's a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, remove her from the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha and Mother Miriam step forward uncertainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would someone please remove the defendant from the courtroom. (continues in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nuns lead Agnes, still singing past Martha and out of court.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: It is full winter; many shots of the convent and surround dissolving into one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know the meaning behind the song she sang. Perhaps it was a song of seduction. And the father was a fieldhand. Perhaps the song was simply a lullaby that she remembered from many years ago. And the father was hope and... and love and desire. And a belief in miracles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nuns are seen walking together through the snow back the convent over    which Agnes' singing can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to believe that she was blessed. And I do miss her, and I hope that she's left something, some little part of herself with me. That would be miracle enough wouldn't it?

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Where Agnes is singing her song among the doves. She stop singing and the music fades in on the same key. Agnes gen on of the doves and lets it fly away across the snowy landscape. FADE OUT. END TITLES.
